intro: Epilobium luteum var. lilicinum, commonly known as the yellow willow herb, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers with four petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, often sunny habitats such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
